intro: Periploca albicans, commonly known as the white periploca, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Periploca albicans is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
